actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5. The next meeting is scheduled for 11:00 a.m. on July 2, 2024.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5, the Chair announced the Speaker's designation of the period from Friday, June 28, 2024, through Sunday, July 7, 2024, as a "district work period."
The Clerk was authorized to correct section numbers, punctuation, and cross references, and to make other necessary technical and conforming corrections in the engrossment of H.R. 8774.
The Clerk was authorized to correct section numbers, punctuation, and cross references, and to make other necessary technical and conforming corrections in the engrossment of H.R. 8752.
The Clerk was authorized to correct section numbers, punctuation, and cross references, and to make other necessary technical and conforming corrections in the engrossment of H.R. 8771.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 212
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 200

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Meng moved to recommit to the Committee on Appropriations.
The House adopted the amendments en gros as agreed to by the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8771 — "Making appropriations for the Department of State, foreign operations, and related programs for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."
Pursuant to clause 1(c) of Rule XIX, the House resumed consideration on H.R. 8771.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 212
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 201

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Mr. Magaziner moved to recommit to the Committee on Appropriations.
The House adopted the amendments en gros as agreed to by the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8752 — "Making appropriations for the Department of Homeland Security for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 217
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 202

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Mr. Quigley moved to recommit to the Committee on Appropriations.
The House adopted the amendments en gros as agreed to by the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House rose from the Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union to report H.R. 8774.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Titus amendment; Failed by recorded vote: 129
On agreeing to the Tenney amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 211
On agreeing to the Tenney amendment; Agreed to by recorded vote: 201

actions-list.actionItem: At the conclusion of debate on the Titus amendment No. 171, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the noes had prevailed. Ms. Titus demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Titus amendment No. 171.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Titus,  numbered 171 printed in Part A of House Report 118-559 to prohibit funds in the bill from being used to acquire, use, transfer, or sell cluster munitions.

At the conclusion of debate on the Tenney amendment No. 164, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Case demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Tenney amendment No. 164.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Tenney,  numbered 164 printed in Part A of House Report 118-559 to prohibit funding to finalize, implement, or enforce the FAR Council's proposed "Federal Acquisition Regulation: Disclosure of Greenhouse Gas Emissions and Climate-Related Financial Risk" rule.

At the conclusion of debate on the Tenney amendment No. 163, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mrs. McCollum demanded a recorded vote and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1316, the Committee of the Whole proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Tenney amendment No. 163.
An amendment, offered by Ms. Tenney,  numbered 163 printed in Part A of House Report 118-559 to prohibit funding for Executive Order 14019, relating to Promoting Access to Voting.
The House resolved into Committee of the Whole House on the state of the Union for further consideration.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 8774 — "Making appropriations for the Department of Defense for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2025, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Ms. Kelly of IL to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Rev. Brett Jamrog, Sacred Heart Parish, Norfolk, Nebraska
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
